>>I don't see why on earth you would write a test by overwriting runTest, 
>>but let's take that as an example.
> 
> It's in Test Infected, Vladimir. Your assignment is to re-read the article. :)

Wow!  In fact it's documented.  It's maybe useful when you don't have 
reflection (J2ME?) but I must admit that I never used this static way of 
executing a single test.  Maybe because I have more than one single test 
to execute :-)

Anyway I'm the living proof that you don't have to know this technique 
to write/execute tests :-)

-Vladimir
